Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 02:00 25/02/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QM1508'

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 00:30 25/02/2025. If this changes, we will update this message.

We have had reports of damage to our network by a third-party which has in turn caused the power to go off in your area. We know where this damage has taken place and our teams are working hard to make the situation safe, repair the damage and get your power back on. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'QM1913'

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 19 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 14:40 24/02/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 02:00 25/02/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

Faults.name: SN13 & SN14 Areas

Faults.message: Planned outage: We're sorry for the loss of power. The reason you're currently without power is a planned outage in the areas listed. We have turned off your electricity supply to allow us to safely carry out essential work to our electrical equipment. By doing this, it'll help us to improve the reliability of our service to you for the future. If you have any questions or require more information, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook or Twitter @ssencommunity) with reference '235837'. You will have received a letter from us confirming your power will be interrupted, with specific information relating to your property. If you did not receive this letter, you can assume your power will not be interrupted.
